Hey, you: Get a load of this cloud! High-altitude ice clouds (like this one) can help regulate Earth's temperature by reflecting energy from the Sun.

A new 
@NASAEarth
 mission called PoISIR aims to study them in greater detail to improve climate forecasts. https://go.nasa.gov/3IAfgjj

We're holding a public meeting of our independent study team on unidentified anomalous phenomena (UAP) on Wednesday, May 31, at 10:30am ET (1430 UTC), with a media teleconference to follow. 

How to watch: https://go.nasa.gov/42tSGAX

Submit your questions: https://go.nasa.gov/42uzK4J

14 years ago, 
@Astro_Mike
 wrote the first tweet from space. Since then, we’ve been sharing snippets of our life in orbit—and what it’s like to gaze upon our home planet.

Follow along: http://nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/active…

This 
@NASAWebb
 image of the Pillars of Creation helps astronomers determine how stars form. Plus, it makes pretty sweet digital wallpaper.

Download high-resolution images from https://webbtelescope.org.

When the Relativity Space Terran 1 rocket lit up the night sky as it launched this past March, it became the first 3D-printed rocket test of its kind. Learn about GRCop—an innovative, high strength material at the center of this breakthrough: https://go.nasa.gov/44igKrA

For the first time, two @NASA super pressure balloons are in flight at the same time!

The two balloons launched from New Zealand with a primary goal of testing & qualifying the super pressure balloon tech for flight, while also flying science missions. https://go.nasa.gov/3pzfNvk

Over their eight days on the @Space_Station, the private astronauts of @Axiom_Space's Axiom Mission 2 will run activities from student outreach to scientific experiments.

#Ax2 is set to lift off from @NASAKennedy on Sunday, May 21—here's how to watch: https://go.nasa.gov/41yAdlp

Follow along: http://nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/active…
LIVE: Cosmonauts are about to embark on a spacewalk to deploy and activate a radiator that will help cool the @Space_Station’s Nauka science module: http://nasa.gov/live

New images from @NASAPersevere may show evidence of what was once a wild and deep river on Mars. The observations are leading scientists to rethink how ancient water once flowed on the Red Planet. https://go.nasa.gov/41tYxEP

This @NASAWebb image of the Pillars of Creation helps astronomers determine how stars form. Plus, it makes pretty sweet digital wallpaper.

Download high-resolution images from https://webbtelescope.org.
Solid answers, good job everybody. And as for us? We love exploring, but there's no place like home.

Whistles. Crunches. Whooshes.

These are a few of the space sounds heard in a new citizen science project called HARP.
By participating, you can investigate cosmic vibrations recorded by NASA spacecraft that help sing the song of the Sun and Earth.

More: http://go.nasa.gov/3mDXm7o

Astronauts need spacesuits for different occasions: life and work inside a spacecraft, spacewalks, and one day, planetary walks. In this episode of the Curious Universe podcast, we explore spacesuit design and creation, from fittings to new features: https://go.nasa.gov/3zxE6LK
LIVE: An update on the science of #TEMPO, a space-based instrument that will revolutionize the way scientists observe air quality.
LIVE: NASA and @Axiom_Space leaders are providing the latest updates on #Ax2, scheduled to send an international crew of private astronauts to the @Space_Station in early May. Listen in:
The Soyuz MS-23 crew ship with three Exp 69 crewmates aboard docked to the Prichal docking module at 5:22am ET today completing a 37-minute relocation maneuver. More... https://go.nasa.gov/3nPnhcF

LIVE: Astronaut Frank Rubio and two cosmonauts are moving their Soyuz MS-23 spacecraft to a new docking port on the @Space_Station. Undocking is scheduled for 4:45am ET (0845 UTC), with redocking targeted for 5:23am (0923 UTC).

We need your help to @DoNASAScience! Many of our citizen science projects can be done by anyone, anywhere, with just a cell phone or laptop. Find a project that sparks your curiosity this #CitSciMonth: http://science.nasa.gov/citizenscience

Together, we've explored Earth, flight, and space. From the #Artemis I launch to the Moon to the DART asteroid impact to @NASAWebb’s first cosmic images. You're part of it all, including nine nominations for the #Webbys!

Voting is open through April 20: https://go.nasa.gov/3KBXNZl

NASA experts will join @Axiom_Space at noon ET (1600 UTC) on Thursday, April 6, to discuss the upcoming launch of Axiom Mission 2. #Ax2 is the second all-private mission to the @Space_Station. How to tune in: https://go.nasa.gov/412KmqK
Get to know the #Artemis II astronauts headed to the Moon! Learn more about @Astro_Christina, @Astro_Jeremy, @AstroVicGlover, and @Astro_Reid: https://nasa.gov/specials/artemis-ii/…

Welcome to Twitter, @NASAScienceAA! 

Dr. Nicky Fox, our head of #NASAScience, will share updates about topics and missions ranging from our changing planet to our expanding universe. Follow along: http://science.nasa.gov
